results.title: Pearson Island
results.brief_description: Pearson Island, in the Great Australian Bight, supports a varied native fauna. Sea-lions live there permanently, and the sea birds include penguins, terns, oyster-catchers and Cape Barron geese. Saltbush and she-oak forest on higher ground have land birds and a native rat and wallaby extinct elsewhere. Commentary by Roger Cardwell.

results.title: Pearls in the north [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Don Murray and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Examines the pearling industry in the far north of Australia. After a post-war decline the industry now has a bright future. Nine luggers, from Broome, with Japanese and Malay crews, work the rich pearlshell beds. Shows diving techniques and a cultured pearl farm.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Oliver Howes, Don Murray and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Pearls and savages (1921)
results.creator_credit: Frank Hurley and Stoll Film Co
results.brief_description: Frank Hurley (1885-1962) was firmly established by 1925 as Australia’s most famous photographer. After World War 1, having filled the position as the first official photographer of the Australian war effort, Hurley became interested in Papua New Guinea. In December 1920, he left Australia to record the work of Anglican missions in Papua and to make “travelogue entertainment”. The result was this documentary, “Pearls and Savages” which was released in Sydney, in December 1921.

results.title: Pearlers
results.creator_credit: Lee Robinson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: An insight into the work of the pearling industry on the northern coast of Australia. Shows the preparation of the diver before going below; the hazardous work as he gathers pearl shell from the sea floor; opening the shells, searching for pearls and packing the shell on board the lugger; return of the lugger to port and packing of the shell for export.

results.title: Pearl Harbour December 7th
results.brief_description: A few cameras were on hand to record the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7th 1941, film director John Ford’s unit was given the task of recreating many of the major scenes on Hollywood sound stages. Generations of Americans have witnessed the scenes, not realising the attack is actually Ford’s skilful illusion. Historically, the film is accurate in every detail. Winner of the Academy Award for Documentary Production in 1943.

results.title: Pearl Harbor = Pearl Harbour
results.creator_credit: Michael Bay, Jerry Bruckheimer and Jerry Bruckheimer Films
results.brief_description: Resoundingly derided drama about the invasion on Pearl Harbor by the Japanese, this film, directed by Michael Bay, nonetheless contains some impressive sequences, mostly the expertly executed and detailed battle scenes. Less engaging is the love triangle between two pilots, and the girl they both fall for. Cast includes Ben Affleck, Josh Hartnett, Kate Beckinsale, Cuba Gooding Jnr, Jon Voight.

results.title: Pearl Harbor
results.creator_credit: Jerry Bruckheimer Films, Touchstone Pictures, Michael Kaplan, Michael Bay, Jerry Bruckheimer, Pat Sandston, Randall Wallace, Nigel Phelps, K.C. Hodenfield, Kenny Bates, Mitzi Haralson and Jennifer Klein
results.brief_description: The lifelong friendship between Rafe McCawley and Danny Walker is put to the ultimate test when the two ace fighter pilots become entangled in a love triangle with beautiful Naval nurse Evelyn Johnson. But the rivalry between the friends-turned-foes is immediately put on hold when they find themselves at the center of Japan’s devastating attack on Pearl Harbor on Dec. 7, 1941.

results.title: Peaches, pears and people
results.brief_description: Looks at the peach and pear industry in the Shepparton district, Victoria - from the initial cultivation of the crops to the final stages of production in the factory.
